dt: {bc}to cause to move vigorously through a wide arc or circle
{bc}to cause to sway to and fro
{bc}to cause to turn on an axis
{bc}to cause to face or move in another direction

dt.t: {wi}swing{/wi} the car into a side road

dt: {bc}to suspend so as to permit swaying or turning

dt.t: cranes {wi}swinging{/wi} cargo into the ship's hold
wasn't able to {wi}swing{/wi} a new car on his income

dt: {bc}to play or sing (something, such as a melody) in the style of swing music
{bc}to move freely to and fro especially in suspension from an overhead support
{bc}to move in or describe a circle or arc:
{bc}to turn on a hinge or pivot
{bc}to convey oneself by grasping a fixed support
{bc}to play or sing with a lively compelling rhythm
{bc}to shift or fluctuate from one condition, form, position, or object of attention or favor to another

dt.t: {wi}swing{/wi} constantly from optimism to pessimism and back

dt: {bc}to start up in a smooth vigorous manner
{bc}to hit or aim at something with a sweeping arm movement

pt: {sc}swing{/sc} {sc}wave{/sc} {sc}flourish{/sc} {sc}brandish{/sc} {sc}thrash{/sc} mean to wield or cause to move to and fro or up and down. {sc}swing{/sc} implies regular or uniform movement.
{sc}wave{/sc} usually implies smooth or continuous motion.

{sc}swing{/sc} {sc}sway{/sc} {sc}oscillate{/sc} {sc}vibrate{/sc} {sc}fluctuate{/sc} {sc}waver{/sc} {sc}undulate{/sc} mean to move from one direction to its opposite. {sc}swing{/sc} implies a movement of something attached at one end or one side.
{sc}sway{/sc} implies a slow swinging or teetering movement.
{sc}oscillate{/sc} stresses a usually regular alternation of direction.
{sc}vibrate{/sc} suggests the rapid oscillation of an elastic body under stress or impact.
{sc}fluctuate{/sc} suggests constant irregular changes of level, intensity, or value.
{sc}waver{/sc} stresses irregular motion suggestive of reeling or tottering.

et: Middle English, to beat, fling, hurl, rush, from Old English {it}swingan{/it} to beat, fling oneself, rush; akin to Old High German {it}swingan{/it} to fling, rush
shortdef: to cause to move vigorously through a wide arc or circle
to cause to sway to and fro
to cause to turn on an axis

dt: {bc}an act or instance of {a_link|swinging} {bc}swinging movement: such as
{bc}a stroke or blow delivered with a sweeping arm movement
{bc}a sweeping or rhythmic movement of the body or a bodily part
{bc}a dance figure in which two dancers revolve with joined arms or hands
{bc}jazz dancing in moderate tempo with a lilting syncopation
{bc}the regular movement of a freely suspended object (such as a pendulum) along an arc and back
{bc}steady pulsing rhythm (as in poetry or music)
{bc}a steady vigorous movement characterizing an activity or creative work
{bc}a trend toward a high or low point in a fluctuating cycle (as of business activity)
{bc}an often periodic shift from one condition, form, position, or object of attention or favor to another
{bc}the driving power of something swung or hurled
{bc}the progression of an activity, process, or phase of existence
{bc}the arc or range through which something {a_link|swings}
{bc}something that swings freely from or on a support
{bc}a seat suspended by a rope or chains for swinging to and fro on for pleasure
{bc}a course from and back to a point {bc}a circular tour
{bc}jazz that is played (as by a big band) with a steady beat and that uses the harmonic structures of popular songs and the blues as a basis for improvisations and arrangements
{bc}a short pass in football thrown to a back running to the outside

shortdef: an act or instance of swinging : swinging movement: such as
a stroke or blow delivered with a sweeping arm movement
a sweeping or rhythmic movement of the body or a bodily part

dt: used to say that two choices or situations are basically the same because they have an equal number of advantages and disadvantages

dt.t: It is a case of {it}swings and roundabouts{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that two choices or situations are basically the same because they have an equal number of advantages and disadvantages

dt: {bc}pop music usually performed by Black musicians that combines elements of jazz, funk, rap, and rhythm and blues

shortdef: pop music usually performed by Black musicians that combines elements of jazz, funk, rap, and rhythm and blues

dt: {bc}swing music played typically on country-music instruments (such as guitar, fiddle, or steel guitar)

shortdef: swing music played typically on country-music instruments (such as guitar, fiddle, or steel guitar)

dt.t: I'll {it}swing by{/it} after work to drop off the paperwork.
I'll {it}swing over{/it} after work to drop off the paperwork.
